EPIC, Your AI Quality Companion is now 
live

Enhance productivity, optimize accuracy, and scale your operations like never before!
Read Full Article

The TAUS Massively Multilingual AI Contest in Dublin this June offers you a 6-minute spotlight to showcase groundbreaking language AI solutions. 
With a chance to win the prestigious award and potentially attract significant investments, this can be your moment to shine.

Can machines really judge translation quality as well as humans?
Discover how our TAUS QE model performs against traditional human evaluation methods, the factors that influence assessment variations, and what this means for the future of translation quality workflows.

subject: Be Part of Creole’s Digital Future  Maria!
body:
Celebrating 10 Years With Us!
Haitian Creole In Digital Age: From Spoken Word 
To Global Platforms.
 
Bonjou Maria!
 
What is possible?
 When it comes to Haitian Creole in the digital age, the answer is more exciting than ever.
 
For generations, Creole thrived in conversations, music, and storytelling. But now, it’s making waves in spaces once thought unreachable—on social media, in digital platforms, and across global networks. The demand for Creole is growing and  transforming the way people connect, communicate, and claim their linguistic identity.
 
In 2022, Creole Solutions played a pivotal role in this movement, helping one of the world’s biggest tech companies localize their platform entirely in Creole. The result? A moment of pure joy and validation for countless Creole speakers who finally saw their language fully represented in the digital world.
 
What is possible?
 
Haitian Creole In The Digital Age!
The rapid rise in demand for
 Haitian Creole
 was an indication of major shifts in language use. Soon after their arrival, Haitian immigrants in the U.S. no longer relied on the stilted French they had learned in school and instead turned to Creole as their main language of communication. 
 
With Creole already spoken and used in print, for example for tax forms, it was hardly a surprise that
 social media came next.
 
Thousands of people began to exchange messages in Creole on social platforms. In 2022, 
Creole Solutions
 was selected by one of the giants in the social media business to help translate the entire user interface of their platform.
 
Creole was entering the digital age, and 
Marleen and her team
 were right in the middle of the effort. Many people had the same response when they first saw the fully localized interface in their own language: Tears of joy.
 
 
LocWorld
 is the leading conference for global business, translation, and localization—bringing together experts shaping the future of language access. At LocWorld, Marleen Julien shared how
 Haitian Creole
 is making its mark in the digital world, including the launch of a social media platform fully accessible in Creole.
Celebrate with Us!
 
What’s Next?
Haitian Creole is making strides in digital spaces. From social media platforms to online learning and business tools, the language is reaching more people than ever before. Creole is no longer just spoken—it’s written, shared, and embedded in the digital world.
 
Each month, we will highlight a new way Haitian Creole is expanding. Let’s continue the conversation. Share your thoughts and experiences—because every step forward for Creole is a step toward greater access and visibility.
Learn more about us
 
Stay in the loop!
For more updates and exciting news, make sure to follow our page and stay connected with us on social media. 
 
 
 
 
Creole Solutions, 4957 Oakton Street, Suite 203, Skokie, IL 60076, United States

Time Is Running Out to Save!
 
 
Early Bird Pricing Ends
March 28, 2025, 12:00 am CET
Just a few days left to take advantage of our Early Bird pricing for LocWorld53 in Malmö, Sweden, this June.
Why Attend a LocWorld Conference?
Gain valuable insights and expertise through innovative sessions.
Tap into fresh inspiration that drives your business strategy forward.
Engage with localization industry professionals and peers. 
Register Now & Save!
 
 
 
 Global Toolbox 
Spotlight
TermClub: GenAI and Terminology Augmented Generation
This full-day, hands-on workshop is packed with valuable insights to help you leverage the potential of generative AI with terminology optimization.  
Why Attend? 
Generative AI and large language models (LLMs) are reshaping industries where content and language play essential roles. There's never been a better time for language professionals to leverage 'terminology databases' to amplify the accuracy and value of AI outputs. 
  
What You'll Walk Away With:
Practical, actionable knowledge to revolutionize your AI outputs and a deeper understanding of the intersection between terminology and AI. 
Learn More
 
Curious about other sessions? 
- Multilingual Roundtable
- Localization 101
- Global Strategy Playbook Workshop
- 
Software Internationalization (i18n) and Unicode Technologies
 
 
The Localization Institute offers several interactive seminars and round tables as part of the upcoming Global Toolbox Day at LocWorld53 in Malmö, Sweden on Tuesday, June 3, 2025. These sessions will take place at the Clarion Hotel & Congress Malmö Live.
These seminars and round tables are separate, stand-alone events, and registration for LocWorld Malmö is not required to attend a Global Toolbox session.

WEBINAR INVITATION | AI: BEYOND THE HYPE
 
Is there anything AI can’t do? 
Tuesday 8 April 2025 | 15:00 BST, 16:00 CEST, 10:00 EDT | 60-minute webinar
Register today
 
Exploring AI’s Real-World Limits in Localization

Hi there Maria,
I wanted to give you a heads up that I will be out of the office April 1-12, with limited access to my email. Unfortunately, I won’t be able to take on any projects during this time and I look forward to working with you again after that. 
From April 23rd I will be working in CEST time zone as I am relocating back to Sweden where I will be looking for new opportunities in localization, content marketing or UX writing. I will continue working with current clients, but also looking for new employment.
Here’s a short summary of my experience:
🌍 What I Do:
🔹 Localization & Transcreation – Ensuring content doesn’t just translate, but truly resonates.
🔹 Content Strategy & UX Writing – Making digital experiences seamless across cultures.
🔹 SEO & Digital Marketing – Optimizing content for international visibility.
🔹 Community Growth & Engagement – Building brand trust through localized messaging.
🚀 My Experience Includes:
✅ Localizing and adapting marketing and UX content for the Swedish market for brands like Dropbox, Microsoft, and Skype.
✅ Leading SEO localization & digital content at Contentoo.
✅ Creating a successful content platform (Marketing Tips for Translators) with 10,000+ engaged followers and 6500 newsletter subscribers.
✅ Hosting an award-winning podcast with 280+ episodes on marketing and localization.
Warm regards, 
Tess Whitty

subject: Webinars: Basics of SEC Investigations, Demystifying AI, and more!
body:
Get convenient compliance education with SCCE webinars
 
  
Stay up to date on the latest in compliance & ethics
  
Webinars are an excellent resource for continuing education! All live webinars offer CCB CEUs and NASBA CPE credits, and many sessions are CLE-approved. You can also purchase on-demand content for instant viewing.
  
SCCE members get four free webinars per year, plus discounted registration
 
on additional sessions!
 
Learn more about membership
  
  
UPCOMING WEBINARS
  
 
Basics of SEC Enforcement Investigations
with Kevin Muhlendorf
Understanding the role of the SEC Enforcement Division and the scope of its investigative authority, to include both public and private entities
Learning how to efficiently and effectively respond to SEC investigative subpoenas and voluntary requests for information
Understanding the interplay between a robust compliance program and preventing or mitigating the effects of SEC investigations
Learn more & register
 
 
Creating a Records Retention Schedule That Is Easier to Execute and Also Supports Privacy and AI
with Mark Diamond and Tim Mighell
Understand the elements of a modern schedule: Integrate compliance, privacy, and business value into a single schedule
Resolve data minimization and recordkeeping conflicts: Resolve potential conflicts between retention rules and privacy data minimization mandates
Enable automation: Design a schedule that supports automated classification and disposition for improved efficiency
Foster AI Compliance: Learn how a schedule can either help or hurt compliant use of generative AI
Build consensus: Learn strategies to align business groups on what information to retain, how long to keep it, and what can and should be defensibly deleted
Learn more & register
 
 
Data Privacy in Higher Education
with Elizabeth Elices
Gain a better understanding of the unique data privacy concerns relevant to higher education
How Colleges and Universities must comply with data privacy standards impacting students, employees, alumni, donors, and the work of the institution
Provide a general overview of the topic of data privacy as it applies to the unique needs of this industry
Learn more & register
 
 
Insights into Legal, Ethical, and Practical Aspects of Corporate Investigations
with Ramina Dehkhoda-Steele
Understanding the Fundamentals of Corporate Investigations
Navigating Legal and Ethical Considerations
Conducting Effective Internal Investigations
Managing Risk and Legal Exposure
Building and Presenting an Investigation Case
Addressing Compliance and Policy Issues
Learn more & register
 
SEE ALL UPCOMING WEBINARS
 
Instantly access previously recorded webinars in our On-Demand Learning Center
 
See all on-demand learning

body:
Welcome to Board Buzz, your recap of the latest District 214 Board of Education meetings. Click HERE
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

View on web
|
Read what you missed
Welcome to 
Board Buzz
, your recap of the latest District 214 Board of Education meetings. Click 
HERE
 to rewatch the meeting from March 13, or read on for the highlights. You can view the agenda and relevant documents 
HERE
.
🌎
 Click 
HERE
 to translate this newsletter in another language. At the top of this link, select your language of choice in the dropdown menu.
1. Life Students Lead Pledge
Check this out: 
Students from the Life Program at Forest View Educational Center proudly led the Pledge of Allegiance at the recent board meeting. The program serves students ages 18 to 22 who are developing the skills needed for work and adult life. As these students prepare to exit the program this year, their participation showcased their growth and accomplishments. District 214 is proud of their achievements and looks forward to their bright futures.
2. Honoring Student Achievement
Celebrating our students: 
D214 proudly recognized students excelling in Fine Arts and winter athletics. While their disciplines differ, these students share a foundation of dedication, perseverance and leadership. Students won state honors in these categories: 
- Boys Swimming
- Girls Wheelchair Bowling
- Boys Bowling
- Girls Gymnastics
- Girls and Boys Wrestling
- Competitive Cheerleading
- ILMEA All-State Music Honors
- Illinois High School Theater Festival All-State Company
- Speech
Congratulations
 to our exceptional students! Click 
HERE
 to view more photos from our student recognition.
3. New Food Service Partnership
What's new: 
The Board of Education approved a contract with 
Quest Food Management Services
 to oversee food service operations, ensuring efficiency and an improved dining experience for students while retaining all current staff. 
A committee of administrators and stakeholders evaluated vendor proposals before selecting Quest for its expertise in high school dining. Quest will introduce updated service models, expanded meal options and ongoing student feedback, with the transition beginning this summer and full implementation set for the 2025-26 school year.
4. Summer Improvement Plan
Need to know: 
The board has approved a 
Summer 2026 Capital Improvement Plan
 to upgrade infrastructure, modernize facilities and improve energy efficiency while maintaining financial stability.
Wheeling High School
 – Redesigned Student Services area, upgraded auto shop and HVAC, and critical pool infrastructure repairs.
Rolling Meadows High School
 – Plaza redesign with new canopy, walkways, seating and landscaping for outdoor learning and gathering.
Buffalo Grove High School
 – New Building Automation System for improved climate control.
These upgrades ensure modern, efficient and student-focused learning environments for years to come.
5. Roll Call Action Items
Click 
HERE
 to see documents related to the following Roll Call Action and Discussion items from the March 13 meeting:
10.1.1. Approval to Dispose of Closed Session Audio Recordings Pursuant to the Open Meetings Act
10.2.1. Approval of Preliminary Financial Guidelines and Assumptions
10.2.2. Approval of Accounts Payable
10.2.3. Approval of Financial Statements for January, 2025
10.2.4. Approval of Food Services Manager
10.2.5. Approval of Encumbrance and Expenditure Authorization
10.3.1. Approval of the Freedom of Information Act Report
10.4.1. Approval of Wheeling HS Rooftop Units Replacement
10.4.2. Approval of Summer Construction 2026 Authorization: Wheeling HS Student Services Renovation, Auto Shop Roof and Mechanical Replacement, Pool Renovation Project 
10.4.3. Approval of Buffalo Grove HS Building Automation System Installation
10.4.4. Approval of Heating and Air Conditioning Equipment at Wheeling HS
🗓
 The next Board of Education meeting is scheduled for April 10 at 7 p.m. at Forest View Educational Center.
Was this edition useful?
Your responses are anonymous

Unsubscribe

Axios HQ

subject: Improve compliance program effectiveness: Attend an SCCE Academy!
body:
Advance your compliance knowledge through our interactive, comprehensive Academies
 
 
An unparalleled level of applied learning + comprehensive information
  
Offering foundational, hands-on learning, valuable peer connections, and a certification exam option, it’s no wonder the Basic Compliance & Ethics Academy is one of our most sought-after learning experiences! 
 
Participants learn core compliance principles and how to apply them in real-world situations through instruction by experienced faculty, small group discussion, and problem-solving exercises. The interactive format facilitates networking and often results in lasting professional connections.
Make plans now to be part of this unique learning experience!
  
US ACADEMIES
April 28–May 1 • Las Vegas, NV
July 21–24 • Nashville, TN
August 11–14 • Jersey City, NJ
October 6–9 • San Antonio, TX
December 8–11 • Anaheim, CA
 
GLOBAL ACADEMIES
June 23–26 • Brussels, Belgium
July 7–10 • Singapore
August 25–28 • São Paulo, Brazil
October 13–16 • Barcelona, Spain
November 10–13 • Dubai, UAE
Class sizes are limited, and spots fill up fast: Find your preferred dates and location and register today!
View all Academies
 
 
 
Enhance your professional credibility through certification. 
Academy attendees have the option to sit for the Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional (CCEP)® (US Academies) or Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional-International (CCEP-I)® (global Academies) certification exams, offered on the last day (separate application and fee required).

subject: Time Is Running Out! 🕰️
body:
Take advantage of early bird pricing
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Time Is Running Out to Save!
 
Take advantage of our early bird pricing and register today! 
Enhance your expertise, forge meaningful connections, and stay at the forefront of the localization industry.
What Can You Expect at LocWorld?
Gain insights and knowledge through forward-thinking sessions
Discover fresh inspiration to enhance your business strategies
Connect and engage with localization professionals and peers
Register Today & Save!
 
 
 Getting to Malmö
Flying International? 
Malmö is situated at the southern end of Sweden. If you are arriving internationally by air, the fastest route is to fly into Copenhagen (CPH) and take the train from the airport for a twenty-minute ride over the Öresund Bridge to the Malmö Central Station, just a seven-minute walk from the conference hotel.
 
 
Book Your Stay
Clarion Hotel Malmö Live
LocWorld53 will be hosted at the Clarion Hotel Malmö Live. Conveniently situated in the middle of Malmö next to Malmö Central Station and within walking distance to shopping areas, restaurants, and many tourist attractions. 
Book Accommodation
 
 
 Global Toolbox Spotlight
Transform Localization with Multilingual AI
AI is reshaping the localization industry, and the Multilingual AI Roundtable at Global Toolbox Day is your opportunity to stay ahead of the curve. Join this full-day session to explore how AI-driven solutions and Large Language Models (LLMs) are revolutionizing workflows with topics like:
Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG)-based MT with LLMs
Intelligent multilingual content orchestration
Human-AI collaboration and ethical considerations
Key Takeaways:
Design innovative localization workflows with AI agents
Understand what AI Agents can and cannot do
Build valuable connections with industry leaders
Seats are limited—register now to secure your spot!
Learn More
 
Curious about other sessions? 
- 
TermClub: GenAI and Terminology Augmented Generation
- Localization 101
- Global Strategy Playbook Workshop
- 
Software Internationalization (i18n) and Unicode Technologies
 
 
The Localization Institute offers several interactive seminars and round tables as part of the upcoming Global Toolbox Day at LocWorld53 in Malmö, Sweden on Tuesday, June 3, 2025. These sessions will take place at the Clarion Hotel & Congress Malmö Live.
These seminars and round tables are separate, stand-alone events, and registration for LocWorld Malmö is not required to attend a Global Toolbox session.
Register Today
 
Last Call
LocWorld54 Call for Papers
 
Today is the last day! Submit your proposal today for LocWorld54. Topics will explore how localization can embrace change, integrate new technologies, and prepare for the next generation of challenges. Be a part of the conversation.
Deadline Extended, March 20, 2025
 
Submit Your Proposal Today
 
Looking Ahead
June 3-5, 2025
 - 
LocWorld53
 in Malmö, Sweden 
October 14-16, 2025
 - 
LocWorld54
 in Monterey, CA, USA 
 
Platinum Sponsor

subject: WLGC | Internal Communication in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
body:
Fireside Chat with Monique Zytnik
 
 
 
WLGC | Internal Communication in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
📅 Date: 27th March, 2025
⏰ Time: 09:00 AM – 10:00 AM PST
🔗 Location: Online
Join Women in Localization (Global Community) for an exclusive conversation with 
Monique Zytnik
, award-winning internal communication leader and author of 
Internal Communication in the Age of Artificial Intelligence
.
Discover how AI is transforming the way organizations communicate at scale and learn actionable insights from Monique’s globally recognized expertise. From her award-winning campaigns to her thought leadership in communication strategies, Monique has helped businesses worldwide connect more effectively with their people.
Don’t miss this opportunity to explore how leaders can leverage AI to build stronger, smarter communication practices in the workplace.
Interview by
: Cristina Grigoroiu
Guest
: Monique Zytnik
AGENDA
Intro of Women in Localization & Global Community
Introduction to the authors
Fireside Chat
Q&A
This event will be hosted and moderated by the Events team within Global Community of Women in Localization
About the Author:
Monique Zytnik is an award-winning, global internal communication leader based in Berlin, Germany. She has worked internationally, presented on best-practice communication at world conferences, and guest-lectured at universities. Her campaigns have been recognized by Gartner, Mumbrella CommsCon, and the Digital Communication Awards. She regularly shares her knowledge through communication industry publications and podcasts, drawing on her in-house and consultancy work with international organizations. Her book Internal Communication in the Age of Artificial Intelligence helps leaders strategically communicate better at scale with their people. Recently it was Winner Technology- Gamechange and Finalist in Marketing in the Goody Business Book Awards. She is the Chair of the International Association of Business Communicators EMENA Region and a member of Global Women in PR Germany.
All participants joining the event will get an exclusive discount for a custom workshop hosted by Lamiaa specifically for Women in Localization. The workshop will follow our March 6th discussion and be scheduled for March 19th.
🔴 This live event will be hosted on Zoom and it will be recorded. It’s free to attend but you have to register through Eventbrite so we can email you the Zoom login details.
The event is open to everyone but the recording will only be available to Women in Localization members.

here
!

join the wonderful W.L. community of 14,000+ localization professionals

—all free, no commitment.

subject: 🎉 March Newsletter: 10 Years & Beyond | Featured in Multilingual, Women’s Empowerment & More!
body:
Join us for Women’s Month workshops & more!
Celebrating a Decade
 with us!
As of 2025, our newsletter is now bilingual! To access the Haitian Creole version, 
sign up here
.
 
As we kick off 2025, we are thrilled to celebrate 
10 years of Creole Solutions!
 This milestone is a testament to our commitment to bridging language barriers and empowering communities through translation, interpretation, and cultural expertise. We have an exciting year ahead, and we look forward to sharing our journey with you.
 
What’s Possible with Haitian Creole Series
As part of our 10th-anniversary celebration, we are launching a new series: 
What’s Possible with Haitian Creole.
 Each month, we will explore different ways Haitian Creole is making an impact across industries and communities. So far, we have covered:
January Spotlight: Job Growth
 – How Haitian Creole can open doors for careers in translation, interpretation, customer service, healthcare, and more.
February Spotlight: Learning 
– The role of Haitian Creole in education, and its use in science, technology, and academic research to make knowledge more accessible.
This series is our way of reflecting on the journey so far and envisioning the future of Haitian Creole in various sectors. 
Stay tuned 
for more topics, including success stories, insights, and the evolving role of Haitian Creole in today’s world!
Our Contribution
to the Language Industry
Marleen Julien Featured in MultiLingual Magazine:
We are proud to announce that 
Marleen Julien 
has been featured in 
MultiLingual Magazine’s 2025 Language Industry Influencers list! 
The February 2025 issue highlights individuals shaping the language industry, showcasing voices too impactful to ignore.
 
This recognition underscores Marleen's contributions to language accessibility and the promotion of Haitian Creole on a global scale.
Read the feature
 
Community Engagement for Women’s Month:
In honor of Women’s Month, we are excited to present a workshop at the Community Fair, hosted by the Haitian Grassroots Coalition of the Midwest. This session will cover essential resources, including:
 
✅ 
Business registration
 – How to navigate the process of starting a business.
✅ 
Social media marketing
 – Strategies for building an online presence.
✅ 
Digital tools
 – Leveraging Canva, Amazon’s Digital Doors, and other platforms for business growth.
📆 Date: 
March
 22, 2025
📍Location: 
International District Community Center - 
3540 Commercial Dr, Indianapolis, IN 46222
 
Help us spread the word! If you know someone who could benefit from this workshop, please share this with them.
Premium Interpreting Services
 Creole Line
We offer premium interpreting services for businesses, organizations, and individuals seeking professional Haitian Creole interpreters. Whether for medical, legal, business, or community needs, our on-demand and remote interpreting services ensure clear and effective communication.
 
📞 
Don't miss out on our Creole Line.
 
Request an interpreter today!
Call 
312-598-2173
 or visit our website.
Learn more
 
🇭🇹 
Creole Corner 🇭🇹
Bannann Peze
Have you tried 
Bannann Peze
?
If not, you’re missing out on a simple yet flavorful treat! Here’s why it’s a staple in Haitian cuisine:
🍌 Made from 
green plantains
, which are sliced, fried, smashed, and fried again for the perfect crispy texture.
🔥 Best enjoyed fresh, often with a sprinkle of salt or served alongside 
fried meats, seafood, or sauces
.
🌶️ Pairs perfectly with 
pikliz
, adding a tangy and spicy contrast.
 
📸 
Craving this dish?
 Click below for the recipe! If you give it a try, don’t forget to tag us in your photos—we’d love to see your creations!
Get the recipe
 
Stay in the loop!
For more updates and exciting news, make sure to follow our page and stay connected with us on social media. 
Visit our website
 
 
 
 
 
Creole Solutions, 4957 Oakton Street, Suite 203, Skokie, IL 60076, United States

subject: Learn the secrets to a compliance-friendly workforce at our upcoming Workshop
body:
Don’t miss the highly recommended Creating Effective Compliance Training Workshop!
 
 
“The best training I have ever attended!” 
– 
Past attendee
Whether you have a successful compliance training program that you want to keep fresh or are building a new program from scratch, you won’t want to miss 
this workshop
 where you’ll learn strategies designed to engage employees and inspire them to champion compliance in their day-to-day routines.
  
When you effectively motivate your workforce to embrace compliance & ethics, you help drive organizational benefits, including:
Employee awareness
 of industry legal requirements and their importance
Risk reduction
 by empowering teams to help identify and mitigate risk areas
Ethical behavior
 and a healthy speak up culture
Stakeholder trust
 through your demonstration of a commitment to ethical standards
Consistency
 of expectations and approach to regulations across teams
Financial stability
 from a reduced likelihood of potential fines, lawsuits, and profit loss
Industry leaders Kirsten Liston and CJ Wolf will provide insights on who to train, content development, principles of adult learning, how to measure success, and what it takes to build a training program that works. 
View the agenda
Join us April 16–17
 for this opportunity to strengthen your compliance training program and earn live continuing education units including up to 14.9 Compliance Certification Board (CCB)® CEUs and 14.8 NASBA CPE credits conveniently from home or office. 
See all approvals
Register now
 
Can’t make it in April? 
Join us in October
!
Here’s what past attendees have told us about their workshop experience: 
  
“Content of the course was spot on!”
  
“Knowledge of the presenters was excellent. Loved the ‘live’ course format, great interaction among attendees.” 
  
“The curricula were very helpful. I was able to jot down many direct application initiatives.”

Register Today!
  
  
 
Boosting Retention and Satisfaction: The Power of Automated Customer Value Touches
Monday, March 17, 2025
12:00 PM CDT
Hi Maria,
   
In today's dynamic and ever-evolving insurance landscape, employers must navigate the complexities of risk management and ensure compliance with constantly changing regulations. They must also face the daunting challenge of balancing rising insurance costs with the need to maintain comprehensive coverage. As a result, they’re becoming ever more reliant on organizations like yours to help them face these challenges head-on.
 
The challenge for you? Being able to provide this value in a scalable way across your book.
 
Join us for a live webinar event to learn about the steps you can take to use a digital approach to automate value touches across your customer base and make an immediate impact.
 
In this session we will cover:
‘Always On’ Customer Service: Ensure your clients receive support whenever they need it.
Automated Touchpoints: Stay in front of your clients with personalized, automated communications.
Value Realization: Position yourself as a resource they can’t go without, not just another tech vendor.
New Marketing and Service Opportunities: Explore innovative ways to market and serve your clients.
Register now to secure your spot.
 
Can’t make the live session time? No worries! Register anyways and we will send you a copy of the recording.

subject: See You May 15th at ELE's Milwaukee Talent Conference at Manpower
body:
Get ready to transform your leadership development and talent management approach with actionable insights from top professionals.
 
 
Connect With Great Minds: 
ELE Community 
  
🌟 SAVE THE DATE! 🌟 MAY 15, 2025 🌟
ELE's Talent Development Conference
at Manpower (Milwaukee, WI)
Maria, 
In today's fast-paced world, fresh ideas and time for reflection have become precious commodities. At ELE, we understand this reality, which is why our one-day program is specifically designed to allow you and your team to step back from daily routines and immerse yourselves in intensive personal and professional growth.
This year, we’re thrilled to host our Milwaukee conference at Manpower, a venue at the forefront of global workforce innovation. This location is not only centrally accessible but also renowned as a hub for pioneering talent development strategies and their impactful World of Work Research.
 
 
Join us to learn and share "best and next" practices for 'Workplace Agility in the AI Era':
Date: May 15, 2025
Agenda: 
Preview online
Location: Manpower, 100 Manpower Place, Milwaukee, WI
Explore & Sign-up:  
ELE's Conference and Registration Event
READY TO INSPIRE? 
SHARE YOUR PERSPECTIVES 
Have a practical idea that could transform the future of HR and Talent development? Your story deserves the spotlight! We're inviting you to share your vision on the ELE stage and ignite meaningful conversations with leaders in the field - @ 
#ELEWISE2025
Embrace this unique opportunity to engage with thought leaders and peers who are shaping the future of our industry by connecting with
 
 
Dirk Tussing
. 
Register today and be part of the conversation that drives real change. 
🚀
 
The Power Of ELE
Want to understand the power of ELE’s collective intelligence with forward-thinking peers?
Schedule a walk-through
 
 
 
 
 
 
Access Our On-Demand Talent Solutions
Our 
ELE Insights
 lets you learn on-demand from your peers either on your computer or mobile devices. Slides, podcasts, videos and more! Here are links to the four most recent events with post-sharing multimedia recordings.
Strategic Re-skilling: Explore How AI is Transforming Workforce Capabilities
Microlearning in the AI Age: Building Adaptive, Personalized Learning Experiences
AI Practical Lab: Building a High-Performance Coaching Assistant
Strategic DEI Reimagined: From Employee Groups to Business Impact in 2025 and Beyond
 
UPCOMING EVENTS & LIVE DISCUSSIONS
These sessions feature experts sharing the latest research and insights on navigating leadership challenges, leveraging AI, and boosting retention
. 
Register now
 
to secure your spot!
 
Explore Upcoming Events | Fresh Ideas & Discussions
 
 
It's time to add our ELE Meetup events to your agenda.
      
Mar 19: 
ELE Chicagoland Meetup | Arlington Heights
 
Connect with fellow colleagues in an engaging conversation where Talent Development Innovation Meets Practice.
Grab a co-worker, and we'll see you at Cooper's Hawk Winery & Restaurants
 
Why Invest Your Time and Energy in ELE?
Stay Ahead of the Curve:
 ELE’s hybrid shift is a strategic breakthrough that aligns with the future of work. Gain insights from our community to stay ahead of talent development trends.
Expand Your Network: 
Connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build a network that transcends borders. The power of collaboration within our trusted community is limitless.
Get Practical Tips and Tools:
 Receive actionable takeaways for enhancing your talent development initiatives. ELE’s journey provides practical tips and tools for immediate implementation.
WE’RE ALWAYS READY TO ANSWER.
Questions? Please contact 
help@ele.llc
 or 
book time with me
.
Our goal is to exceed your expectations with our Brand Promise.
Connect and Share for Stronger Business Impact
Learn new skills and explore talent development capabilities through ELE’s HR platform of peer-shared insights, for improved business performance.
ELE

🌎
 Click 
HERE
 to translate this newsletter in another language. At the top of this link, select your language of choice in the dropdown menu.
Assessing D214’s aging facilities
 
Construction is moving quickly at Hersey High School, with the framing for offices and conference rooms already taking shape.
The Board reviewed an in-depth assessment of the District’s infrastructure, highlighting aging buildings that require significant updates. Experts from architectural and engineering firms, along with construction managers, evaluated District 214’s buildings and identified key infrastructure needs, including HVAC systems, roofing, plumbing, classroom modernization and athletic facility updates. The assessment outlined more than $850 million in potential improvements, underscoring the need for strategic prioritization and funding solutions. The District’s facilities were built decades ago, and while ongoing maintenance has kept them functional, larger-scale improvements are needed to ensure they continue meeting students’ educational needs. 
Exploring funding strategies
 
Elk Grove High School's student services area was renovated over the summer.
With major improvements necessary, the Board explored various funding options, including potential bond measures, grants and other financial strategies. The discussion focused on balancing the urgency of repairs with fiscal responsibility, ensuring that any funding approach is sustainable and minimizes impact on taxpayers. The Board is committed to maintaining financial stability while addressing the infrastructure needs of the district.
Long-term planning for schools of the future
 
The new state-of-the-art culinary lab at Elk Grove High School was unveiled in the fall.
In addition to addressing immediate facility needs, the board discussed long-term strategic planning to modernize school buildings and create learning environments that align with evolving educational needs. Plans include reviewing spaces to support innovative teaching methods, integrating new technology, and improving energy efficiency across all facilities. Future projects may focus on upgrading science labs, expanding career and technical education facilities, and enhancing common areas to foster collaboration and student engagement.
Commitment to safe and effective learning environments
 
Students can gather, meet college representatives and attend events at Elk Grove High School's new multi-purpose postsecondary center.
The Board reaffirmed its dedication to providing students with safe, well-maintained and innovative learning spaces. Investments in facilities are directly tied to student success, as modern, well-equipped classrooms contribute to engagement and achievement. The Board will continue evaluating priorities to ensure all schools remain state-of-the-art for current and future students.
Next steps and community engagement
 
Buffalo Grove High School's athletic fields are being upgraded and improved.
The Board will continue reviewing infrastructure needs and potential funding strategies in upcoming meetings. Community engagement will play a key role in determining the path forward, with opportunities for stakeholders to provide input on priorities. The District has issued a Request for Proposals (RFP) to identify a consultant to assist with the community engagement process. Stay tuned for further updates on how District 214 is planning for the future.
Roll Call Action Items
Click 
HERE
 to see documents related to the following Roll Call Action and Discussion items from the February 28 meeting:
6.1. Approval of Accounts Payable
6.2. Approval of Financial Reports December 2024
6.3. Approval of Personnel Transaction Reports
6.4. Approval of Job Descriptions
7.1. Facilities Maintenance Master Plan
🗓
 The next Board of Education meeting is scheduled for March 13 at 7 p.m. at Forest View Educational Center.

subject: WLSP: The rising tide of LLMS with #GlobalSponsor Smartling
body:
WLSP: The rising tide of LLMS
 
 
 
WLSP: The rising tide of LLMs
 
Join us for a welcoming and insightful discussion on the rapidly growing world of Large Language Model (LLM) technology. This new technology is set to transform machine translation, translation evaluation methods and metrics, as well as ethical standards. Whether you’re eager to embrace LLMs or still unsure, this session will bring you up to speed on the latest developments that every localization professional should know. By the end of this session, you’ll be ready to navigate the rapidly evolving LLM landscape, whether you’re ready to implement these tools or just want to better understand their potential impact.
Here’s what we’ll cover:
Metrics evolution
: Learn which traditional metrics are becoming outdated with the rise of LLMs. We’ll dive into new evaluation methods that focus on context and nuanced language, offering a more comprehensive view of translation quality.
Mitigating hallucinations
: LLMs are powerful, but they come with challenges. We’ll explore how to detect and minimize “hallucinations”—instances where models generate incorrect or misleading information—and examine ways LLMs are improving at self-correcting errors. This helps ensure more reliable and trustworthy translations.
Embracing opportunities
: With diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) at the forefront of conversations today, we’ll discuss how LLMs handle things like gender biases and their strengths and weaknesses in promoting inclusive translations.
S﻿peakers
Alex Yanishevsky
: Senior Director of AI and Machine Translation, Smartling
Alex is the senior director of AI and machine translation at Smartling and has been in the localization industry for over 20 years. His areas of expertise include AI, NLP, machine translation, data mining, computational linguistics, content management, and TMS/CAT tools. Alex serves as VP of AMTA (American Machine Translation in the Americas). He writes articles for industry journals such as MultiLingual and presents at industry conferences such as GALA, LocWorld, TAUS, and AMTA.
Olivia Norris
:
 
AI Solutions Intern, Smartling
Olivia Norris is an AI Solutions Intern at Smartling and a physics and data science student at UC Santa Barbara. As part of her internship at Smartling, she has conducted research on LLM benchmarking and gender debiasing in AI-driven translations.

Early Bird Registration for LocWorld53

The early bird registration for LocWorld53 in Malmö, Sweden

Gain industry know-how from cutting-edge sessions

The Localization Institute is excited to offer several interactive seminars and round tables as part of the upcoming Global Toolbox Day at LocWorld53 in Malmö, Sweden on Tuesday, June 3 2025. These sessions will take place at the Clarion Hotel & Congress Malmö Live.
As a co-organizer of the LocWorld Conference, the Localization Institute offers these seminars and round tables as separate, stand-alone events. 
Registration for LocWorld Malmö is not required to attend a Global Toolbox session. Please fill out the first page on the registration site of LocWorld, then go to the second tab to finish registration.

March 2025 Newsletter
 
ELEVATE
6-
8 May 2025
Save the date!
 
📅 Mark your calendars! ELEVATE returns for a bigger and bolder edition spanning across three exciting days filled with learning, inspiration, and connection.
 
This year's edition will include our annual 
RWS Campus
 event, making it our biggest conference yet! Over three days, ELEVATE will provide valuable insights and connections for everyone in the translation industry – from students starting their localization journey to seasoned experts.
 
Here’s a rundown of what you can expect:
Day 1: 
Innovate

Motivate
 
- Stay ahead of the curve with in-depth discussions on industry trends and transformative innovations shaping the future of translation.

subject: Riding the AI Shockwave
body:
Download our global research report today
View in browser
 
 
 
Around 70% of global consumers are seeing an increase in AI generated content
What does this mean for businesses and consumers? How do we navigate the opportunities for experimentation and enthusiasm? Is the role of humans in tool development a significant consideration for consumers and does it impact their trust?
 
We're excited to share with you the launch of our research report: 
Unlocked 2025: Riding the AI Shockwave
.

Perspective is everything

Beyond words
Native is the new normal

subject: IWD 2025: Women in Localization Accelerates Action for Equality
body:
This year’s International Women's Day focuses on Accelerate Action / For ALL Women and Girls: Rights. Equality. Empowerment.
 
📅 
Date
: Mar 7, 2025
⏰ 
Time
: 8 AM PT - 5 PM CET
🔗 
Location
: Zoom - Online event
Panelists: 
Tulia Lopes, Monique Zytnik, and Madhu Sundaramurthy
Monderator: 
Agustina Pioli
Women in Localization is bringing together industry leaders for a conversation about action, empowerment, and equality. This year’s International Women’s Day theme—
Accelerate Action
—reminds us that change doesn’t happen on its own. It takes real effort to break down barriers, create opportunities, and ensure all women and girls have the rights and resources they need to succeed.
Join panelists 
Tulia Lopes, Monique Zytnik,
 and 
Madhu Sundaramurthy
, along with moderator 
Agustina Pioli
, for a discussion about the realities women face in their careers. They’ll examine important topics, including:
✅How to promote equality in the workplace
✅ Why women are more likely to seek coaching
✅What are the threats and challenges to inclusion and diversity in today’s evolving world
Women in Localization has always been about empowerment, innovation, and community. This event is a chance to connect, learn, and be part of the movement toward a more inclusive future. Let’s take the first steps toward equality together.
This event will be hosted by the Women In Localization - Marketing Team.
🔴 This live event will be hosted on Zoom and it will be recorded. It’s free to attend but you have to register through Eventful so we can email you the Zoom login details.
The event is open to everyone but the recording will only be available to Women in Localization members.
📢📢📢

here

...and much more! :)

join the wonderful W.L. community of 14,000+ localization professionals

subject: WLGC | The Successful Woman's Wake-Up Call
body:
Your Body's Blueprint for Reinvention
 
 
 
WLGC | The Successful Woman's Wake-Up Call: Your Body's Blueprint for Reinvention
📅 Date: 6th March, 2025
⏰ Time: 09:00 AM – 10:00 AM PST
🔗 Location: Online
What happens when you have checked all boxes of success, but your body is screaming for change?
Join 
Women in Localization Global Community
 to learn from 
Lamiaa Laurene Daif
, former Private Equity Director turned Apple strategist and TEDx Speaker, as she reveals how an auto immune disease became her wakeup call to reinvent success on her own terms.
In this raw honest conversation, you will discover:
Why high achieving women often feel empty despite having it all?
Why your body holds the key to authentic leadership and impact?
The secret to creating success without sacrificing your wellbeing
Interview by
: Belinda Hilbert
Guest
: Lamiaa Laurene Daif
AGENDA
Intro of Women in Localization & Global Community
Introduction to the authors
Fireside Chat
Q&A
This event will be hosted and moderated by the Events team within Global Community of Women in Localization
About the Author:
Lamiaa is the Worldwide Growth Strategy Leader for Mac and iPad at Apple, an Executive and Business coach, and an award-winning keynote speaker. She created the Inside-Out Model® to help organizations and individuals achieve transformations starting from within. She serves as Treasurer and Board Member for Resonate Workshops, empowering women and girls in Africa. With over a decade as a Director at Europe’s largest Private Equity Fund, Lamiaa now supports mission-driven founders as an angel investor and advisor. A Stanford GSB alumna and Robert Joss Scholar, she is also a TEDx speaker and frequent guest at global conferences on leadership, women empowerment and innovation. In 2024, Lamiaa was named to Morocco’s 40 Under 40 list, the Arab America Foundation’s 40 Under 40 list, and received the Speaker of the year 2024 award by Women in Tech Network.
All participants joining the event will get an exclusive discount for a custom workshop hosted by Lamiaa specifically for Women in Localization. The workshop will follow our March 6th discussion and be scheduled for March 19th.
🔴 This live event will be hosted on Zoom and it will be recorded. It’s free to attend but you have to register through Eventbrite so we can email you the Zoom login details.

subject: [Expensify] Travel and expense, at the speed of chat
body:
tl;dr - Introducing Expensify Travel: fully managed corporate travel via web, app, or chat – now available to every Expensify member
 
Travel and expense should go hand in hand… and now they can! We've long been asked by customers big and small for the ability to: 
Book flights, hotels, rail, and car rentals from inside the app.
Limit what inventory employees see to only what is in the authorized travel policy.
Pay for these bookings using a central virtual card.
Capture the travel receipts into an automatic expense report.
Cut travel costs
In 
New Expensify
, press the green + button 
> Book travel
 (or in 
Expensify Classic
, click the 
Travel
 button along the left side of the screen). It does all the things you expect (in-policy booking results, travel-based spend analysis, out-of-policy notices, approvals before booking, duty-of-care reporting), plus a few tricks you don't – courtesy of the realtime chat framework of the New Expensify superapp: 
Realtime duty of care
, which lets you know where all your employees are at all times. We even connect the traveler and travel manager in a dedicated chat room to discuss all bookings and changes the instant they happen, rather than whenever you get around to checking your inbox.
Realtime expense management,
 where every booking receipt and change fee is recorded as an expense that's submitted up through Expensify's realtime approval and next-day reimbursement engine: book today, get paid tomorrow!
Realtime collaboration
, where shared trip chat rooms are automatically created in New Expensify so that everyone is on the same page. From employees to managers, everything you need to know about your trip, all in one place. 
The instant, chat-first design of New Expensify is why we like to say that Expensify does:
Travel and expense at the speed of chat.
To check it out, open your Expensify app and click 
Travel
, or take a peek below!
It's one of the most exciting times to be at Expensify that I can ever remember. We have a 
lot
 going on, and it's energizing to be sharing it with you after so long in development. Keep an eye out for a ton more on the way!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me in the 
#new-expensify-feedback
 room! 
PS: Check out OpenAI's work on building an 
artificial engineer
 to solve Expensify App open source projects!
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103
To unsubscribe, please click 
here

subject: 📚 Celebrating a Decade of Creole Solutions and Learning!
body:
Celebrating 10 Years of Learning
with us!
Bonjou Maria!
 
As we continue celebrating Creole Solutions’ 10-year journey, this month’s spotlight is on 
Learning
, 
one of the most powerful ways we’ve seen Haitian Creole break barriers and open doors.
 
For too long, higher education and professional research in Haiti were associated almost exclusively with French, leaving Haitian Creole on the sidelines. But that’s changing, and Creole Solutions has played an active role in this shift.
In 2022, The United Nations launched its new website for Haiti in Haitian Creole.
What is possible? 
Learning!
Historically, higher learning in Haiti has been associated with French, as Haitian Creole was considered a spoken language. That perspective has undergone quite a few changes in the last decade, and 
Creole Solutions
 is proud to have played a role in this shift.
 
 
What learning is and how it is accessed have evolved
, with Haitian Creole gaining greater recognition. When the New York Times published an article on Haitian history in both English and Haitian Creole on May 23, 2022, it caused a sensation.
Later in the same year, the 
United Nations
 launched its brand-new website for Haiti 
in beautifully crafted Haitian Creole. Marleen and her team have always felt strongly that Haitian Creole can only be elevated by prioritizing proper grammar and spelling. 
These days, it is not uncommon for research institutes and museums to request translations from us. 
 
We were honored to collaborate with the Museum of Contemporary Art to include Haitian Creole translations in 
Didier William: Nou Kite Tout Sa Dèyè
.
 This powerful book, published alongside William’s largest solo museum exhibition, delves into race, immigration, and memory through his monumental paintings, printmaking, and sculpture.
 
The title, which translates to 
We’ve Left That All Behind
, reflects the Haitian immigrant experience—the journey of displacement, adaptation, and resilience. By incorporating Haitian Creole, we ensure that these narratives reach those who connect most deeply with them, reinforcing the idea that language should never be a barrier to understanding.
In Haitian culture, we say
 
Kreyòl pale, kreyòl konprann
—
when Creole is spoken, it is understood. When people have the opportunity to learn and engage in their own language, knowledge becomes more accessible, voices are amplified, and communities thrive.
 
Celebrate with Us!
 
From academic research to museum exhibitions, our language is breaking barriers and creating new opportunities. Every translation, publication, and collaboration brings us closer to a future where
 Creole is not just spoken but recognized, studied, and celebrated.
 
What’s Next?
Each month, we’ll share another story of what’s possible with Haitian Creole, celebrating the growth, creativity, and cultural pride that Creole Solutions has brought to life over the past decade.
 
Join us in championing Haitian Creole as a language of learning, knowledge, and innovation. Share your thoughts, stories, and experiences with us—because when 
Kreyòl pale, kreyòl konprann
, anything is possible!
Learn more about us
 
Stay in the loop!
For more updates and exciting news, make sure to follow our page and stay connected with us on social media. 
 
 
 
 
Creole Solutions, 4957 Oakton Street, Suite 203, Skokie, IL 60076, United States

subject: Board Buzz 2.20.25
body:
Welcome to Board Buzz, your recap of the latest District 214 Board of Education meetings. Click the 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

|
Read what you missed
Welcome to 
Board Buzz
, your recap of the latest District 214 Board of Education meetings. Click the date to rewatch the meeting from 
February 13
, or read on for the highlights. You can view the agenda and relevant documents 
HERE
.
🌎
 Click 
HERE
 to translate this newsletter in another language. At the top of this link, select your language of choice in the dropdown menu.
1. Leadership Changes
What's new: 
We are excited to announce two administrative changes. Kate Kraft is our new Deputy Superintendent and Justin Attaway is our new Associate Superintendent for Business Services, effective July 1. 
Kate Kraft
, currently the Associate Superintendent for Human Resources, has been a dedicated leader in District 214 for over 15 years. In her new role as Deputy Superintendent, she will work closely with principals and school leaders, providing support to schools and ensuring staff and students have the resources they need to succeed.
Justin Attaway
, formerly Chief Operating Officer for St. Charles Community Unit School District 303, brings a wealth of experience in school finance and operations. His expertise will be instrumental as District 214 navigates an $850 million facility needs assessment and looks toward future investments in school infrastructure.
2. Distinguished Service Awards
Making a difference: 
The Board of Education recognized eight outstanding individuals with the Distinguished Service Awards. These awards honor community partners, parents, and volunteers who have made a lasting impact on our District and students. Congratulations to this year’s recipients!
Ronda Thomas
 is a huge part of the success of the WildStang Robotics Club. Her dedication through fundraising, managing spirit wear, and chaperoning makes this program accessible to many more students.
David Jacobson 
doesn’t just teach, he inspires. David spends countless hours volunteering his time to help as a math tutor in the D214 Community Education center, where his passion for helping others shines. 
Emily Morrison
’s unwavering dedication to the music department at Buffalo Grove High School includes being the president of three booster clubs, decorating events, organizing wardrobes, and always being ready to help.
Paul Pioch
’s leadership has made a lasting impact on the Elk Grove and Rolling Meadows High School community. He founded the Cereal Bowl, a friendly competition to stock the Elk Grove Food Pantry. As he retires, his legacy will endure for years to come.
John R. Dallas Jr.
 exemplifies what it means to be a mentor at Hersey. He plays a pivotal role in fostering student success as a dynamic entrepreneur seeking to help the next generation of business leaders.
Dina Petricca
 is elevating the proud tradition of the Prospect Marching Knights. Her deep connection to the band program as, both a former drum major and Prospect Band Booster President, fuels her passion for the pursuit of excellence.
Selflessness, dedication, and kindness are all key characteristics of 
Cherish Walsh
. Her creation of the Basket Brigade Program helps spread joy during Thanksgiving by donating meals to families in need.
Cristina Haidau 
is a constant source of support for the Wheeling Fine Arts Program and the math and science initiatives. She goes above and beyond by organizing fundraisers, coordinating events, and volunteering as a judge at science fairs.
3. School Improvement & Financial Planning Update
School improvement progress
Superintendent Rowe shared an exciting update on the District's mid-year school improvement process. Each school has made impressive strides in meeting their academic, post-secondary and climate goals. Schools are developing focused, actionable plans to address their unique needs, with strong collaboration and leadership driving progress.
Financial planning and future growth
D214 is preparing for the 
FY26 budget
, keeping a close eye on revenue from property taxes and federal funding. The District is also managing expenses related to staffing, special education and health insurance, all while exploring opportunities to enhance 
food service operations
. The District is evaluating potential improvements to ensure the continued success of the program.
4. Consent and Roll Call Action Items
Click 
HERE
 to see documents related to the following Consent Agenda and Roll Call Action items from the February 13 meeting:
9.1.1. Approval to Dispose of Closed Session Audio Recordings Pursuant to the Open Meetings Act
9.1.2. Approval of six month review of closed session minutes in accordance with the Open Meetings Act
9.2.1. Approval of the Freedom of Information Act Report
9.3.1. Approval of Accounts Payable
9.4.1. Approval of Bid for Painting Services
12.1.1. Approval of Personnel Transaction Reports
12.1.2. Approval of job descriptions:
Deputy Superintendent
Executive Director Of Human Resources
Director of Technology
Director of Specialized Schools, General Education
Director of Specialized Schools, Special Education
Assistant Director of Specialized Schools, Alternative Programs
Assistant Director of Specialized Schools, Special Education
🗓
 The Board of Education Workshop is scheduled for February 27 at 6:30 p.m. at Forest View Educational Center.

body:
Stronger, Wiser and Still Fabulous!
 
 
 
WLGC | Fireside Chat With Jenn Alvin
📅 Date: 27th February, 2025
⏰ Time: 09:00 AM – 10:00 AM PST
🔗 Location: Online
Whether you’re basking in your victories, weathering emotional storms, or craving a momentary escape, Jenn Alvin’s new book “
Stronger, Wiser and Still Fabulous
” brings the reader an original collection of puzzles, coloring pages, and journal prompts to uplift and inspire you. With every page turn, it holds up a mirror, reflecting the incredible strength and resilience that define you, inviting you to embrace your unique journey with courage and determination.
Join Women in Localization (Global Community) for a fireside chat with the author and a discussion on how to find your own creativity and why it is important to celebrate.

 and for

 and

detail about your rights
, including how you can exercise your right to object/opt-out of your data being sent to a third party; to object/challenge automated processing; and your right to erasure.

Cookies Policy
 and

 of our Privacy Policy.

list of our Sites

API Terms
.

body:

Secure your spot at the IB Global Conference, New Orleans 2025!
After a sold-out conference in Washington, D.C., USA, we are excited to return to the Americas (AM) region! This event welcomes leading education professionals from schools, universities and governments.
Taking place at the 
New Orleans Marriott
 from 
15–17 July 2025
, this conference will be a unique opportunity to meet face-to-face with key decision-makers and educators from all over the world.
Our sponsor and exhibitor packages come with a variety of opportunities to showcase your brand and maximise your impact. Details can be found in the exhibitor prospectus. 
 
Download prospectus
 
 
 
Why should you participate?
Brand Visibility and Recognition:
 Showcase your products to more than 1,700 passionate educators who are excited to discover resources and materials that support them in their careers.
Networking Opportunities:
 Engage with 300 school leaders and decision-makers to discover potential business relationships.
Targeted Audience Reach:
 Ensure that your message reaches the relevant audience by connecting directly with Heads of Schools, programme coordinators and teachers during the conference.
Lead Generation:
 Leverage the conference app and lead capture technology to engage with decision-makers and generate high-quality leads.
Customer Engagement:
 Strengthen relationships with your existing customers by connecting through face-to-face interactions.
Feedback and Market Research:
 Gain valuable feedback on your products or services and insights into market needs and perceptions.
Register here
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
© International Baccalaureate Organization 2025
International Baccalaureate®  |  Baccalauréat International®  |  Bachillerato Internacional®
 
This email is sent from an account we use for sending messages only and is not monitored for replies. If you would like to get in touch with us, please visit our 
Ask a question
 page for contact details.
 
 
 
 
Forward 
 
International Baccalaureate
Rue du Pré-de-la-Bichette 1  |  1202  |  Geneva, Switzerland

Explore SCCE’s Staffing and Budget Benchmarking Survey for valuable organizational insights
 
 
Our 2025 Staffing and Budget Benchmarking and Guidance Survey is now available! How does your organization compare?
We’re pleased to provide you with this exclusive resource designed to provide you with guidance on your organization’s staffing and budget planning for 2025. 
Download your complimentary copy
 of our study results and see where you’re aligned within the industry. 
  
The data was collected in 2024 as part of SCCE’s annual salary survey. We’ve analyzed the data to provide you with these directional benchmarks for compliance department budget and staffing as well as trends within the compliance industry. 
  
As always, we strive to give you the latest compliance updates and information, including insights that can help you manage your program effectively, efficiently, and competitively. We hope you find this information valuable —

subject: AI is Changing eLearning – Are You Ready?
body:
As we continue to navigate the ever-evolving world of learning, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is proving to be a game-changer in reshaping eLearning experiences. This month, we explore how AI is revolutionizing learning strategies, from personalized learning paths to intelligent content curation. 
 We’re also excited to bring you key updates, prestigious recognitions, and an exclusive eBook to help you stay ahead in the L&D landscape! 
 
AI is redefining learning experiences by making training smarter, adaptive, and more efficient. Here’s how AI is transforming eLearning: 
 - Personalized Learning Paths – AI-driven recommendations tailor learning experiences to individual needs. 
 - Automated Content Development – Reduce development time with AI-powered course creation tools. 
 - Data-Driven Insights – AI analytics provide actionable insights for improved learner engagement. 
Want to dive deeper?
 Download our exclusive eBook on ‘Role of AI in eLearning’ . 
Download Your Copy 
Tesseract Learning at the 15th Learning & Development Leadership India Summit 2025 
 
We were honored to be part of the 15th Learning & Development Leadership India Summit & Awards 2025 in Mumbai! This event brought together industry leaders and we shared our expertise on gamification, and immersive learning strategies.
KREDO Shines Again! 
 
We’re thrilled to announce that KREDO Learning Platform has been recognized as one of the ‘Top LMS Tools for Skills Development and Assessment 2025’ by eLearning Industry! This recognition reaffirms our commitment to providing an innovative and learner-centric platform that enhances skill development in today’s fast-paced business environment. 
Explore how KREDO is transforming learning experiences: 
Explore KREDO 
 
Breaking Language Barriers with AI Translation!
 Scaling your eLearning content globally just got easier! 
Prodient.io now empowers course creators with AI-powered translation, enabling seamless multilingual learning experiences in just a few clicks. 
- Instant Course Translation – Convert your content into multiple languages effortlessly. - Accurate & Context-Aware – AI ensures precision while maintaining learning intent. 
- Faster Global Deployment – Reduce localization time and reach a wider audience. 
With AI Translation, you can expand your training programs globally without the hassle of manual translation efforts. Experience the power of AI in eLearning: 
Try Prodient.io 
From Our Blog: Stay Ahead of the Curve!
Keep up with the latest insights in L&D with our expert-driven blogs.
 
 
These thought-provoking articles provide actionable takeaways to elevate your training initiatives this year.
We’re excited to continue this journey with you as we shape the future of learning with cutting-edge innovations. 
Here’s to smarter, more engaging learning experiences!
Best Regards, 
The Tesseract Learning Team

subject: CLE Package: Ethical Attorney Conduct (15 Hours)
body:
Hi Maria,
Our 
CLE Package: Ethical Attorney Conduct
 features 15 hours of courses covering ethics & AI, imposter syndrome, AI billing issues, FTC ban on non-competes, mental health for attorneys, and more.

body:
Take the Translation Technology Insights Survey!
View in browser
 
 
Contact us
February 2025 Newsletter
 
Translation Technology
Insights Survey
Influence the future of translation technology
Have your say!
 
Take part in our 
Translation Technology Insights 2025 survey
 – a global study exploring our industry's needs, challenges, evolving work patterns, and technological advancements needed to support an ever-changing landscape. 
We want to hear from you
 
- the driving force of the translation industry. 
This is your chance to share your insights on:
The work challenges you face every day
Your thoughts on the rise of AI and how it’s reshaping the industry
How you work today - and how you envision that evolving tomorrow
The tools and technologies you need to do your job better.
The survey is available in several languages, and it takes around 20 minutes to complete. Your answers are strictly confidential.
 
As a thank you for agreeing to take part in this research, you can enter our prize draw for the chance to win an 
Ember Travel Mug 2. 
 
Thank you for taking part in this important industry research.
 
Take the TTI survey
 
Webinars
View all recorded webinars
 
What's new in Trados Studio 2024
 
12 February
 
Join our webinar us as we explore the latest innovations in Trados Studio. Discover how new subscription-based licensing, advanced cloud integration, and 
AI-powered
 features are transforming translation management. Ideal for LSPs looking to stay competitive, this session offers insights to help elevate your service offerings.
Register
 
How to translate in Trados Studio 
18 February
 
Register for this webinar to learn the basics of 
Trados Studio
. We'll demo how to create a project in the cloud and translate using key functionality in the online editor and much more. We'll also explain how you can effectively combine the sophistication of the desktop environment with the power of the cloud to increase your productivity!
Register
 
Can't make the date? Don't worry – register anyway and we'll send you the recording.
This webinar will be presented in English.
Boost LSP's efficiency with AI in Trados cloud solutions | 
Webinar recording
Discover how Language Service Providers (LSPs) can unlock new levels of efficiency with the powerful AI capabilities available in Trados cloud offerings. In this webinar, we show you how to leverage cutting-edge features like Generative Translation and Smart Review.
Watch
 
Blogs
Read all our blogs
 
Introducing Neural Fragment Recall: A Smarter Way to Work
 
At Trados, we’re committed to driving innovation that empowers translators and reviewers to work easier, faster and smarter. With that goal in mind, we’re thrilled to introduce Neural Fragment Recall, the new AI-enabled generation of our existing upLIFT Fragment Recall feature. Discover how this new capability elevates translation efficiency by delivering more accurate and consistent fragment suggestions in real-time. 
Read blog
 
Future of machine translation in 2025 and beyond | 
Language Weaver
 
Did you know that machine translation has advanced far beyond simple word-for-word translation? It can now be customized to fit your brand, effortlessly translate audio and video content, and speed up your translation processes by integrating with large language models. Discover some of the major technological advancements that are revolutionizing the way you work and leverage machine translation for your business.
Read blog
 
Upcoming events 
we're looking forward to...
 
ELIA Together 2025
February 20-21 2025, Barcelona
 
We are excited to be a Gold Sponsor at ELIA Together, as the event celebrates its ninth edition. This year’s theme, “Shaping the Future of Translation Together”, focuses on how the language industry is adapting to modern challenges through collaboration and technology. 
Register

FLOWSPARKS
 in this partner spotlight.

Learn more about FLOWSPARKS

I trust this message finds you well. As a professional translator, I have had the pleasure of working with valued clients like Language & Culture Worldwide and I am grateful for your past support.
 
I have enjoyed assisting with your translation, MTPE, editing and review needs over the last years, ensuring accurate communication across languages. I appreciate the trust you have placed in my services.
 
I am reaching out to remind you that my Italian translation services are still available whenever you need. Whether it's technical content, software localization, legal documents, marketing content or any other linguistic assistance, I am here to help.

subject: Board Buzz 1.31.25
body:
Welcome to Board Buzz, your monthly recap of the latest District 214 Board of Education meetings. Cl
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
View on web
|
Read what you missed
Welcome to 
Board Buzz
, your monthly recap of the latest District 214 Board of Education meetings. Click the date to rewatch the meeting from 
January 9
 and 
January 23
, or read on for the highlights. You can view the agenda and relevant documents 
HERE
.
🌎
 Click 
HERE
 to translate this newsletter in another language. At the top of this link, select your language of choice in the dropdown menu.
1. Prospect Snowball students lead the pledge
Check this out: 
Students from Prospect High School’s Operation Snowball program led the Pledge of Allegiance at the January 23 board meeting. This powerful peer-led retreat helps students build connections, encourage personal growth and create a strong sense of community. Several students spoke about their experiences, sharing how Snowball has been life-changing by fostering new friendships and providing a space to be their authentic selves.
2. Opening doors in healthcare careers
Making a difference: 
The Board of Education recognized Bright Light Medical Imaging for its outstanding support of District 214 students in the Healthcare Pathway. Through hands-on learning in radiology, ultrasound, MRIs and CT scans, Bright Light provides students with real-world experience and mentorship that inspires many to pursue careers in healthcare.
By opening their doors to interns and work-based learning opportunities, Bright Light Medical Imaging is making a lasting impact on our students’ futures. Thank you!
3. Vision 2030 shapes Illinois education
The big news: 
The Board of Education has endorsed 
Vision 2030
, a statewide initiative focused on preparing students for success in an evolving world. This effort, led by the Illinois Association of School Boards (IASB) and the Illinois Association of School Administrators (IASA), prioritizes future-focused learning, student well-being and equitable funding while ensuring local control remains in the hands of districts.
Go deeper:
 Developed with input from over 1,000 stakeholders, including educators, policymakers and business leaders, Vision 2030 aims to provide students with the skills, resources and opportunities they need to thrive. District 214 is proud to be part of this movement, helping to shape the future of K-12 education in Illinois.
4. Strengthening support for students
Transportation efficiency improvements:
The Board approved updates to the District’s transportation contract, saving between $1 million and $1.5 million annually. Adjustments to late and early-out shuttles, route combinations and activity buses will reduce costs while maintaining service for students.
Summer Experience 
The Summer Experience Program for 2025 will be hosted at Rolling Meadows High School, with extended school year (ESY) classes taking place at Forest View Educational Center. The program will run in two sessions: the first from June 9 to June 26, and the second from July 7 to July 24, running Monday through Thursday (except 6/20). To account for rising costs, course fees, which have remained at $187.50 since 2020, will increase to $211 this year and will continue to adjust annually. Transportation fees, which have remained unchanged since 2013, will increase from $42 to $84, though the actual cost per student is $173.
Foundation Memorandum of Understanding
The Board of Education approved the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between District 214 and the District 214 Education Foundation, which outlines their ongoing collaboration to support education, innovation and student success through financial and community resources.
The Foundation, an independent 501(c)(3) nonprofit, operates separately from the District but aligns with its strategic goals by funding creative teaching programs, student development initiatives and fostering partnerships. The District provides operational support, including office space, equipment and administrative services at no cost to the Foundation.
5. Consent and Roll Call Action Items
Click 
HERE
 to see documents related to the following Consent Agenda and Roll Call Action items from the January 23 meeting:
9.1.1. Approval of Changes to Board Policy
9.1.2. Approval of Vision 2030 Resolution
9.2.1. Approval of Grand Prairie Transportation Contract Amendment
9.2.2. Approval of Tableau Contract
9.3.1. Approval of HP Large Format Printer Service Agreement
9.4.1. Approval of Summer Experience Program Dates, Locations and Fees
10.1. Approval of Accounts Payable
10.2. Approval to Dispose of Closed Session Audio Recordings Pursuant to the Open Meetings Act
10.3. Approval of the Freedom of Information Act Report
10.4. Approval of Resolution Establishing Preparation and Publication of Tentative Budget 25-26
10.5. Approval of Financial Reports for November
10.6. Approval of Memo of Understanding with the D214 Foundation
12.1. Approval of Personnel Transaction Report
12.2. Approval of Job Descriptions
🗓
 The next Board of Education meeting is scheduled for February 13 at 7 p.m. at Forest View Educational Center.
Was this edition useful?
Your responses are anonymous

subject: Unlock Translation Jobs – Join TranslatorPub.com for Free
body:
Dear Language Professional,
Are you looking to grow your career in the language services industry or expand your company’s reach to new clients? 
TranslatorPub.com
 is the platform where 
linguists
 and 
language service providers (LSPs)
 come together to collaborate, grow, and thrive.
What is TranslatorPub.com?
TranslatorPub.com is a global online marketplace connecting translators, interpreters, and LSPs with individuals and businesses seeking professional language services. With members from over 150 countries, we’ve built a community that fosters opportunities, growth, and collaboration for all language professionals.
Why Join TranslatorPub.com?
For Freelance Linguists:
Access to Job Opportunities:
 Clients post projects daily, offering work in various languages and industries. 
Build Your Brand:
 Create a professional profile that highlights your expertise and helps you stand out. 
Valuable Resources:
 Leverage our tools, glossaries, and guides to improve your skills and efficiency. 
No Risk:
 Registration is 
free
, and many job postings are 
free to access
.
For Language Service Providers (LSPs):
Find Skilled Linguists:
 Tap into a vast network of talented professionals ready to collaborate. 
Grow Your Client Base:
 Gain visibility among businesses seeking reliable LSPs for large-scale projects. 
Efficient Project Management:
 Simplify workflows with a centralized platform for communication and delivery.
What Our Members Are Saying

Maria L., Freelance Translator, Spain

– 
Alex K., Project Manager, USA

– 
Chen W., Interpreter, Taiwan
Why Wait? Join for Free Today!
Registration is completely 
free
, and many job posts are open for all members to access. Take this opportunity to join a thriving community of linguists and LSPs who are shaping the future of the language services industry.
Let’s create another space where 
language professionals can connect, grow, and succeed.
🔗 
Click here to sign up now
: 
Join Our Marketplace For Free
Don’t just take our word for it. Give us a chance to show you how TranslatorPub.com can make a difference in your career or business.
Try our services with a 
special 10 EUR membership for one month
, available for 
just a few days
! This is a great opportunity to explore TranslatorPub.com and all its features. Or, join us long-term with memberships starting at 
ONLY
 
4 EUR per month
, giving you full access, including unlimited job postings. Most members recover this cost with just one client! Explore our membership options here: 
Membership Offers
.
Stay safe from scams!

free guide

This 3-day conference is dedicated to the unique challenges, issues, and strategies that impact compliance professionals in Europe. View agenda
  
 
24th Annual Compliance & Ethics Institute
September 14–17, 2025 • Nashville, TN
September 15–17, 2025 • Virtual (CT)
  
Registration now open!
 Each year, compliance and ethics professionals from around the world gather for the Compliance & Ethics Institute (CEI) to gain cutting-edge education and industry updates, valuable professional connections, and innovative compliance program solutions.
  
CALL FOR SPEAKERS CLOSES SOON:
 Stand out as a leading expert at the primary learning event for compliance and ethics professionals.

.

SEE ALL INSTITUTES 
Specialized Knowledge
 
 
Higher Education Compliance Conference
June 2–4 • Orlando, FL
  
Register now to save!
 Join your peers to gain the latest regulatory news, guidance, and strategies for mitigating risk, keeping data secure, and maintaining an effective compliance program in a higher education setting.
SEE ALL SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE
 
Basic Compliance & Ethics Academies
 
The Academy experience is highly interactive, with a focus on applied learning and networking. Experienced faculty cover a core curriculum of compliance concepts while facilitating small-group discussions and problem-solving exercises to help you learn how to apply key principles to real-world scenarios and build compliance program effectiveness. The optional Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional (CCEP)® exam (US Academies) or Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional-International (CCEP-I)® exam (Global Academies) is offered on the final day (separate application and fee required).
