subject: Maria, With ELE’s Elite Network: Shape the Future of People Development
body:
Advance Your Leadership: Engage with ELE’s Top-tier Talent Network
 
 
Connect With Great Minds: 
ELE Community 
  
LEAD THE CHANGE
Connect with Top People Innovators at ELE
 
 
 
 
 
 
Hi << First Name >>,
Welcome to the First Edition of the ELE Newsletter for 2025!
As we step into this exciting new year, we’re energized by the endless possibilities ahead. 2025 promises to be a year of exponential growth, innovation, and collaboration, and ELE is here to be your partner every step of the way.
Our recent transition to a hybrid community model has made us more connected than ever. This unique setup seamlessly integrates the best of virtual and in-person experiences, enhancing our ability to support you and enriching your journey in navigating the evolving landscape of work. Together, we’ll embrace the challenges and opportunities shaping what’s next in talent development.
Empowering Our Community: Key Focus Areas for 2025
As we dive deeper into 2025, ELE is dedicated to leading the charge in several pivotal areas that are essential for shaping a progressive workplace. Here’s what we’re focusing on:
AI-Driven 'Human-in-the-Loop' Partnership
: With AI increasingly central to modern business, ELE is at the forefront of exploring how AI tools can revolutionize learning content creation and workforce adaptation. We are dedicated to continuous upskilling for leaders and team members, fostering effective collaboration with AI through a 
human-in-the-loop approach.
Creating a High-Performance, Skills-Based Culture
: Shift from traditional metrics to a culture that values agility, skills, and outcomes. We’ll help your team develop a high-performance environment that prepares your workforce for tomorrow’s challenges. This approach emphasizes continuous improvement and agility, ensuring your organization remains adaptable and forward-thinking.
Leveraging People Analytics
: Data is more than just numbers; it’s the key to unlocking potential. We aim to arm you with advanced analytics to make informed decisions that enhance your strategic goals, ensuring your team not only adapts but thrives in the evolving business landscape.
Boosting Employee Engagement
: As we pivot to more dynamic ways of working, engagement becomes crucial. Learn from our innovative strategies to enhance job satisfaction and transform everyday roles into careers of passion and growth.
Reimagining DEI: Strategic Shifts for Business Impact
--facing recent political challenges, it’s crucial to transform DEI from a focus on employee groups to a direct driver of business outcomes. We’re launching a quarterly series to realign DEI strategically to position DEI as a vital business lever, ensuring it contributes tangibly to organizational goals:
 
January 31st Roundtable
: Dive into actionable strategies to navigate external pressures and redefine DEI’s role in business success.
April AI Practical Lab
: Utilize insights from our January roundtable to develop a measurable DEI toolkit, leveraging AI for sustained impact.
What’s in Store for 2025?
ELE is dedicated to being your trusted Talent partner as you build your ELEFolio and embark on your professional journey. Here’s a sneak peek at what you can expect this year:
INNOVATION
We’re committed to staying at the cutting edge of talent development. Whether you're new to the community or a longtime member, ELE has curated tools, resources, and experiences tailored to your unique needs. This year, we’re introducing new ways to help you evolve alongside the rapidly changing workplace dynamics.
 
AI Practical Labs
ELE Learning Circles
Reskilling & Upskilling Pathways
Strategic Futurist Planning
CO-CREATION
Your next big idea, program, or learning experience is just around the corner. In 2025, ELE will be the platform for you to shape the future of your career—and the entire industry. Together, let’s make this a year of innovation and growth!
 
ELE Insights
Program Development Opportunities
CONNECTION
The power of authentic connection has never been more crucial. In 2025, ELE will continue to provide meaningful opportunities to network, collaborate, and share insights. Together, we’ll ignite the sparks that drive success.
 
Virtual Think-Tank Discussions
Idea Exchange Q&A Forum
In-Person Conferences & Quarterly Cohorts
ELE Office Hours
ELE Meetups
Let’s Get Started!
2025 is brimming with opportunities, and we’re here to explore them together. Ready to co-create and push the boundaries of what’s possible? Let’s dive in!
 
ELE MEETUPS
JOIN US
 
Our meetups provide the perfect opportunity to engage with peers, spark fresh ideas, and collaborate on solving today’s most pressing talent development challenges—all in a relaxed, informal setting. This collaborative experience is designed to foster creative conversations and inspire innovative solutions for talent development—while enjoying great wine!
 🍷🥂 
UPCOMING
 
What does your social calendar 
🗓️
 look like? It's time to add our ELE Meetup events to your agenda.
      
Feb 05: 
ELE New York Meetup | NYC / Midtown
Jan 29: 
ELE Chicago Meetup | Naperville
 
Jan 30: 
ELE Chicago Meetup | Morton Grove
Grab a co-worker, and we'll see you next week! 
PLANNING
2025 ELE CONFERENCE DATES
 
MAY 22, 2025
ELE *HYBRID* TALENT DEVELOPMENT CONFERENCE 2025
Location: GE HealthCare
REGISTER
#ELEWISE2025
 
OCT 20, 2025
ELE TALENT DEVELOPMENT CONFERENCE 2025
Location: Zurich Insurance
REGISTER
#ELETALENTCON2025
 
READY TO INSPIRE: SHARE YOU THOUGHT PERSPECTIVE
Have a groundbreaking idea that could transform the future of HR and Talent development? Your story deserves the spotlight! We're inviting you to share your vision on the ELE stage and ignite meaningful conversations with leaders in the field - @ 
#ELEWISE2025 / #ELETALENTCON2025
Connect with
 
 
Dirk Tussing
 
to submit your proposal and become a catalyst for innovation and collaboration - Let's shape the future together! 
 
🚀
 
ELE IDEA EXCHANGE: CONNECT WITH OTHERS 
💡🔥
Join the conversation: 
Idea Exchange
Seeking practical resources for creating a blended virtual live program for new instructional designers; Communication Vendor Recommendations; Shifting to a Global Business Services / Shared Services model for L&D and more. 
ELE IDEA EXCHANGE
Susan Guest
Chief Executive Officer @ Guest Talent
Susan Guest
 started a discussion on our Idea Exchange: 
Creating a blended virtual live program for new instructional designers
Hello, I am new to ELE and appreciate your thoughts on a passion project of mine. I am developing a blended learning program for new-to-instructional design professionals who may be SMEs, trainers, or experts in a related field. While there are some excellent academic and professional programs available in instructional design, my experience is that there are people doing the work who need practical help while developing the skills needed for the future.
At this point, I estimate the ID for Newcomers program participants (8–10) will meet on Zoom weekly to share their work, provide critique, discuss the articles, tools, and resources provided, and plan next steps. Each person will be asked to bring a current project and apply the skills they learn to the course or program they are designing. They would have 2-3 one-on-one meetings with an instructional design expert to provide them guidance.
......
Thank you in advance for your thoughts. I appreciate any practical resources you might recommend. I hope to have the program, or series of discreet courses, ready to pilot starting in Spring 2025. If you know of someone you’d want to send to a pilot, please let me know.
Best regards,
Susan Guest.
UPCOMING EVENTS & LIVE DISCUSSIONS
These sessions feature experts sharing the latest research and insights on navigating leadership challenges, leveraging AI, and boosting retention
. 
Register now
 
to secure your spot!
 
 
Explore Upcoming Events | Fresh Ideas & Discussions
 
Access Our On-Demand Talent Solutions
Our 
ELE Insights
 lets you learn on-demand from your peers either on your computer or mobile devices. Slides, podcasts, videos and more! Here are links to the four most recent events with post-sharing multimedia recordings.
2025 Talent Trends: AI, Skills, Metrics, Leadership, and Business Impact
AI Practical Lab: Building Talent Reviews & Personas—From Theory to Practice
2024 in Review, 2025 in Focus: Defining HR Priorities and Roadmaps for the Future
AI Practical Lab: Creating Podcasts for Leadership Storytelling
Mastering Hybrid Strategies for People Success
 
The Power Of ELE
Want to understand the power of ELE’s collective intelligence with forward-thinking peers?
Schedule a walk-through
Why Invest Your Time and Energy in ELE?
Stay Ahead of the Curve:
 ELE’s hybrid shift is a strategic breakthrough that aligns with the future of work. Gain insights from our community to stay ahead of talent development trends.
Expand Your Network: 
Connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build a network that transcends borders. The power of collaboration within our trusted community is limitless.
Get Practical Tips and Tools:
 Receive actionable takeaways for enhancing your talent development initiatives. ELE’s journey provides practical tips and tools for immediate implementation.
WE’RE ALWAYS READY TO ANSWER.
Questions? Please contact 
help@ele.llc
 or 
book time with me
.
 
Our goal is to exceed your expectations with our Brand Promise.
Connect and Share for Stronger Business Impact
Learn new skills and explore talent development capabilities through ELE’s HR platform of peer-shared insights, for improved business performance.
ELE
 - Connect With Great Minds
Copyright © 2025 ELE Group, LLC, All rights reserved.

We’ll help your team develop a high-performance environment that prepares your workforce for tomorrow’s challenges. This approach emphasizes continuous improvement and agility, ensuring your organization remains adaptable and forward-thinking.
Leveraging People Analytics
: Data is more than just numbers; it’s the key to unlocking potential. We aim to arm you with advanced analytics to make informed decisions that enhance your strategic goals, ensuring your team not only adapts but thrives in the evolving business landscape.
Boosting Employee Engagement
: As we pivot to more dynamic ways of working, engagement becomes crucial. Learn from our innovative strategies to enhance job satisfaction and transform everyday roles into careers of passion and growth.
Reimagining DEI: Strategic Shifts for Business Impact
--facing recent political challenges, it’s crucial to transform DEI from a focus on employee groups to a direct driver of business outcomes. We’re launching a quarterly series to realign DEI strategically to position DEI as a vital business lever, ensuring it contributes tangibly to organizational goals:
 
January 31st Roundtable
: Dive into actionable strategies to navigate external pressures and redefine DEI’s role in business success.
April AI Practical Lab
: Utilize insights from our January roundtable to develop a measurable DEI toolkit, leveraging AI for sustained impact.
What’s in Store for 2025?
ELE is dedicated to being your trusted Talent partner as you build your ELEFolio and embark on your professional journey. Here’s a sneak peek at what you can expect this year:
INNOVATION
We’re committed to staying at the cutting edge of talent development. Whether you're new to the community or a longtime member, ELE has curated tools, resources, and experiences tailored to your unique needs. This year, we’re introducing new ways to help you evolve alongside the rapidly changing workplace dynamics.

Your next big idea, program, or learning experience is just around the corner. In 2025, ELE will be the platform for you to shape the future of your career—and the entire industry. Together, let’s make this a year of innovation and growth!

CONNECTION
The power of authentic connection has never been more crucial. In 2025, ELE will continue to provide meaningful opportunities to network, collaborate, and share insights. Together, we’ll ignite the sparks that drive success.

Let’s Get Started!
2025 is brimming with opportunities, and we’re here to explore them together. Ready to co-create and push the boundaries of what’s possible? Let’s dive in!

JOIN US
 
Our meetups provide the perfect opportunity to engage with peers, spark fresh ideas, and collaborate on solving today’s most pressing talent development challenges—all in a relaxed, informal setting. This collaborative experience is designed to foster creative conversations and inspire innovative solutions for talent development—while enjoying great wine!

Susan Guest
Chief Executive Officer @ Guest Talent
Susan Guest
 started a discussion on our Idea Exchange: 
Creating a blended virtual live program for new instructional designers
Hello, I am new to ELE and appreciate your thoughts on a passion project of mine. I am developing a blended learning program for new-to-instructional design professionals who may be SMEs, trainers, or experts in a related field. While there are some excellent academic and professional programs available in instructional design, my experience is that there are people doing the work who need practical help while developing the skills needed for the future.
At this point, I estimate the ID for Newcomers program participants (8–10) will meet on Zoom weekly to share their work, provide critique, discuss the articles, tools, and resources provided, and plan next steps. Each person will be asked to bring a current project and apply the skills they learn to the course or program they are designing. They would have 2-3 one-on-one meetings with an instructional design expert to provide them guidance.
......
Thank you in advance for your thoughts. I appreciate any practical resources you might recommend. I hope to have the program, or series of discreet courses, ready to pilot starting in Spring 2025. If you know of someone you’d want to send to a pilot, please let me know.
Best regards,
Susan Guest.

subject: WLSP: Upskilling for the AI Era with #GlobalSponsor Lionbridge
body:
Women in Localization: Upskilling for the AI Era with Lionbridge
 
 
 
WLSP: Upskilling for the AI Era
 
The webinar "Upskilling for the AI Era" empowers localization professionals and linguists with the knowledge and tools to remain competitive as artificial intelligence (AI) reshapes the landscape. Industry experts with backgrounds in AI, education, and business will discuss the latest trends shaping the localization landscape. Participants will gain actionable insights into:
- Emerging trends and technologies: Understand the evolving role of AI in localization
- Essential technical skills: Develop proficiency in key technologies like AI-assisted translation tools, data analysis, and project management software
- Continuous professional development: Learn strategies for adapting to the changing demands of the industry, including upskilling programs, certifications, and networking opportunities
M﻿oderator
Susan Morgan
 -
 
VP of Sales - AI, Lionbridge
Susan Morgan is a seasoned leader in sales and account management in the localization and language services industries, currently serving as Vice President of Sales - AI at Lionbridge. In this role, she drives growth and develops strategic solutions that exceed client expectations. She leverages her deep industry knowledge to support clients across verticals. Her volunteer work includes being appointed to the Oregon Council of Health Care Interpreting and serving as Program Director for Strategic Partnerships at Women in Localization, as well as being a Court Appointed Special Advocate for foster youth in Utah.
S﻿peakers
Simone Lamont
 - VP of Global Solutions, Lionbridge
As VP of Global Solutions at Lionbridge, Simone Lamont drives AI-solutions and innovation to enhance the company's language services, ensuring the delivery of high-quality, scalable solutions for diverse global clients. A Kent State University graduate with a Master of Arts in Applied Linguistics, Simone is a seasoned sales and technology manager with a knack for uniting international and interdisciplinary teams. As an advocate for new technical developments, Simone has a proven track record in managing cross-functional teams and spearheading the introduction of new technology. Her solution-oriented and consultative sales approach has proven successful in cultivating long-lasting client relationships.
Winnie Heh
 - Career Advisor, Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey
Winnie Heh has worn many different hats in the language industry – language instructor, translator, interpreter, professor of interpretation, senior executive and consultant for language services companies. She is currently the Career Advisor for the Translation, Interpretation and Localization Management programs at the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. She is a co-Founder of SAFE-AI Task Force, a Board Member and Secretary of the Board for Women in Localization and a committee member of the ALC Bridge. She holds an AA degree in Accounting and Statistics, BA degree in English and MA degree in Conference Interpretation.
Wada’a Fahel
 - Senior Director of Globalization, Tag
Wada’a is a globalization leader with two decades of experience in leading localization strategies and operations for iconic brands such as Xerox, Harley-Davidson, and Zendesk. She joined Tag/DC recently as the Senior Director of Globalization. Her team is responsible for the full globalization lifecycle of strategic accounts.

subject: Turning eLearning Trends into Tangible Results
body:
2025 is here, and the buzzwords in eLearning—AI, immersive tech, personalized learning—sound like the future we’ve all been waiting for. But let’s be honest: implementing these trends can feel more like navigating a maze than riding a rocket to success. 
Here’s the reality: 
 
AI sounds amazing
, but how do you actually use it to create meaningful learning paths that adapt to individual needs? 
Immersive tech (AR/VR) is revolutionary
, but figuring out how to align it with your learning objectives is no small feat.  
Skills matrices are powerful
, but mapping them to real outcomes and tying them back to business goals? Easier said than done. 
Data-driven insights are crucial
, but are your analytics tools giving you actionable information—or just overwhelming you with numbers? 
Learner engagement is key
, but how do you fight digital fatigue while keeping content fresh and relevant? 
That’s where we come in. At Tesseract Learning, we’re the compass you need to navigate these challenges. We help you: 
Transform AI from a buzzword into personalized, scalable training solutions that truly resonate with learners. 
Simplify immersive learning with AR/VR tools that integrate seamlessly into your existing programs. 
Build robust skills frameworks that align training programs directly with business outcomes. 
Leverage analytics to deliver real insights, helping you prove ROI and refine strategies for even better results. 
Design engaging microlearning modules that captivate learners and fit into their busy schedules. 
Curious about what’s shaping eLearning in 2025? - Read the Blog
Let’s tackle these trends head-on and make them work for you. Ready to chat?

subject: 🎉 Celebrating 10 Years of Creole Solutions!
body:
Celebrating 10 Years of Creole Solutions:
January Spotlight: How Translators Found Careers and Community
Bonjou Maria!
 
When we checked, it was hard to believe: 
Creole Solutions is turning 10 this year
, and there are so many reasons to celebrate!
 
When Marleen realized in 2015 that it was time to step up her freelance work and expand the scope of what she could do, she asked herself: 
What is possible with Haitian Creole?
 
As it turned out, there were quite a few possibilities!
 
As part of our 
yearlong anniversary celebration
, we’re launching the 
“What’s Possible with Haitian Creole” series.
 Each month, we’ll explore one of the incredible ways Creole Solutions has helped push the boundaries of what’s possible with Haitian Creole.
January - What is possible? 
Job growth.
 
The 2010 earthquake in Haiti and the political turmoil that followed led to a surge in demand for translations into Creole. As Haitians arrived in the US in large numbers, there were only a handful of qualified translators available to meet the enormous language needs of the group.
 
Almost overnight, Marleen had to find ways to expand and qualify a team that met her rigorous standards.
 
As project after project rolled in and the calls just wouldn’t stop, Marleen took it upon herself to train a handful of promising Haitian translators. She showed them how to work efficiently with translation software, wrote grammar guides, and developed terminology lists. - She 
revised
,
 
t
aught
, and 
mentored tirelessly
.
 
Ten years later, she oversees a growing team of translators and interpreters who have become experts in their areas of expertise. From translating essential documents to interpreting during critical health and legal situations, this team has impacted countless lives while breaking barriers and building understanding.
Over the past decade, the company has trained, supported, and empowered hundreds of translators and interpreters to thrive professionally while contributing to the rich tapestry of Haitian Creole language and culture.
 
Smith, shown here, was one of the first team members to join Creole Solutions.
 
Marleen conducting a remote meeting with the team.
Celebrate with Us!
As part of our celebration, we’ve captured stories from our team of translators and interpreters across the US, Haiti, and the Dominican Republic. Hear directly from them about what Creole Solutions has meant for their careers, their communities, and their connection to the Haitian language.
 
What’s Next?
Each month, we’ll share another story of what’s possible with Haitian Creole, celebrating the growth, creativity, and cultural pride that Creole Solutions has brought to life over the past decade
Want to learn more or join the celebration? Follow us on social media, visit our website.
 
Stay tuned for more stories and events as we celebrate 10 amazing years of making Creole count. 
Learn more about us
 
Stay in the loop!
For more updates and exciting news, make sure to follow our page and stay connected with us on social media. 
 
 
 
 
Creole Solutions, 4957 Oakton Street, Suite 203, Skokie, IL 60076, United States

View in browser
13 Key AI Predictions for 2025
­
Comprehensive Analysis
 for Every Business
­
­
Free Resources
­
Watch the webinar replay and read the articles to delve into a comprehensive analysis of each of the 13 predictions, featuring use cases, case studies, and demonstrations
­
Visit The Website
 
General AI Predictions
AI Will Prove Its Value in Everyday Business
AI is becoming a core part of business operations, driving innovation, productivity, and measurable ROI.
AI Gets Affordable
Cutting-edge optimizations in models and hardware are drastically lowering costs, making AI accessible to businesses of all sizes.
Foundation Model Leaders Focus on Applications
Labs like OpenAI and Anthropic are pivoting to create tailored applications that address real-world needs.
Meta Will Monetize Llama AI Models
With its widespread adoption, Meta’s Llama models will lead a new wave of responsible AI monetization.
The AI Agent Revolution
AI agents are set to transform automation, embedding intelligence into workflows and driving seamless decision-making.
RAG + Knowledge Graphs Will Dominate
Modular AI systems, powered by Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and knowledge graphs, will outperform traditional custom models in scalability and cost-efficiency.
Compliance Drives AI Strategies
Regulations like GDPR and the EU AI Act will force organizations to prioritize security, compliance, and sovereign data solutions.
From Cloud-First to Control-First
Hybrid AI infrastructure will become the norm, offering a balance of control, compliance, and scalability.
 
Language Processing, Localization, and Translation Predictions
AI Outperforms Humans in Language Work
AI now excels in speed, scalability, and precision for tasks like translation, transcription, and editing, surpassing human capabilities.
AI-Assisted Translation Becomes the Norm
Human translators will work alongside AI, focusing on creativity and cultural nuance while AI handles repetitive tasks.
Real-Time Translation Everywhere
AI-powered real-time translation will become a standard feature, breaking language barriers across industries and technologies.
Creative Localization with AI
AI is redefining creative translation, delivering emotionally resonant, culturally nuanced content for global audiences.
The Rise of No-Human-In-The-Loop Translation
Fully automated translation systems will revolutionize workflows, making global communication faster and more cost-effective than ever.
 
­
Omniscien Technologies

subject: Trados Resource hub: A look back at our favorite resources from the past twelve months
body:
Happy 2025 from Trados! | Happy new year from Trados!
View in browser
 
 
Contact us
TRADOS RESOURCE HUB
 
A look back at our favorite resources from 2024
View Trados Resource Hub
 
Welcome the new year with a look back at our top resources of 2024, all of which are available on-demand on the 
Trados Resource Hub
. The team at Trados wishes you a very successful 2025!
 
Bridging borders with Studio 2024
Studio 2024 is the most accessible, feature-rich CAT tool on the market with a number of features for the visually impaired. Building upon our modern, streamlined user experience, Studio 2024 allows you to translate everything more efficiently. 
View Studio 2024 resource page
 
ELEVATE 2024 on-demand
Watch ELEVATE on-demand: The global online gathering for translation professionals to address industry challenges, attend presentations, and explore cutting-edge translation technology – empowering freelancers, language service providers, and corporations.
Watch ELEVATE 2024 on-demand
 
 
9 Trends - old and new - shaping localization
 
Our free eBook explored nine trends impacting the localization industry at the start of 2024. Some of them may feel more like challenges, but we discovered that when approached in the right way, they offer an opportunity for competitive advantage.
Download eBook
 
AI: Beyond the hype webinar series
AI is 
everywhere
. The impact on the localization industry is undeniable, but what does it really mean for you? What will be the long-lasting effect, after the buzz has quietened? We aim to answer your questions in our deep-dive webinar series, AI: Beyond the hype.
Discover more

body:

Rafał Jaworski, PhD
Bridging the skills gap, training Localization professionals in interdisciplinary skills of the future for global-ready leadership impact:

Multilingual AI & Prompt Engineering

Dealing with Difficult Opponents & Challenging Depositions
 
 
Our CLE course, 
Dealing with Difficult Opponents and Challenging Depositions
,
 offers key strategies for witness preparation, ethical considerations, and mastering deposition techniques. This course covers topics such as managing challenging witnesses, addressing obstructionist behavior, handling hostile expert witnesses, and navigating emotional testimonies effectively.
Key Topics Covered:
Strategies for Witness Preparation
Ethics and Fine Line Between Preparation and Coaching
Handling Difficult Witnesses: Mistaken or Forgetful
Dealing with Obstructionist Conduct and Dirty Deposition Tactics
Dealing with Hostile Expert Witnesses and Identifying Red Flags
Etiquette and Technology in Depositions, and much more!
Course Highlights:
Duration
: 1.5 CLE hours of on-demand content
1-Year Access
: 365 Day access to all package materials
Certification
: Earn a verifiable certificate upon completion
Price: $198 for a Limited Time | $436 Regular Price
DISCLAIMER: 
Please review the course description to confirm if it is accredited for CLE credits in your state.
 
CLE Course

subject: Language and Culture Worldwide -- acquiring Managed IT Services
body:
Hi Mar?a
We represent a multi-billion-dollar group actively acquiring MSPs across the US and Canada. They’re particularly interested in MSPs with $1.5M to $200M in revenue, focusing on businesses with at least 50% recurring revenue.
This group is committed to paying very competitive multiples, with a firm stance on not re-trading on LOIs. They’re a solid growth partner who values and supports existing teams, offering the resources and stability needed for sustained growth.
Are you open to a brief call to discuss valuation and strategy? It should only take a few minutes.
Jack Brown
GP Companies
(619) 272-2259
www.gp-companies.com

subject: Looking to the Year Ahead ✨
body:
See what's in store for 2025
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Looking to the Year Ahead
We're looking forward to another exciting year of bringing together localization professionals from across the globe to connect, network, and learn from one another.
Be sure to mark your calendars!
LocWorld53 in Malmö, Sweden - June 3-5, 2025
LocWorld54 in Monterey, CA, USA - October 14-16, 2025
 
 
Coming Soon...
The Call for Papers for LocWorld54 in Monterey will open on January 27, 2025
Sponsorship sales for LocWorld53 in Malmö will begin at 5:00pm CET on Tuesday, January 28, 2025
Exhibit registration will begin at 5:00pm CET on Tuesday, February 25, 2025
Be sure to sign up for all LocWorld emails on the website homepage to be notified when the Call for Papers opens!
Sign Up for all LocWorld Emails
 
 
LocWorld is proud to support the ongoing effort to preserve and protect endangered languages. 
World Endangered Writing Day will take place on January 23, with a live-streamed series of talks and discussions that will introduce the public to script endangerment and revival, from both scholars and community members, and in both live and video format.
A day of talks, discussions, activities, awards, and games supporting the world’s minority and indigenous scripts and their communities.
Join people across the globe to celebrate and support efforts in preserving writing systems as part of humanity's intangible cultural heritage.
Find full details and free registration 
here
.
